data.output: I can't believe he just broke up with me, and even worse he broke up with me over text! My phone pinged and all I saw was the letter for his initials pop up on my text screen. Not even a curtsy call or anything, he simply wrote "This isn't working, it's over" and hit send. I shouldn't have expected anything more as he certainly doesn't get the stamp of approval from my parents.
data.boring_theme: putting a stamp on the envelop containing a letter to send it

data.output: There is something special about writing a letter, a real letter, not an email or a text message. Taking the time to sit down, place a sheet of paper on my desk, choose from one of my favourite pens and just write whilst sipping a cup of coffee. The bit I like best is the satisfaction of inserting the letter in an envelope, licking the glue, sealing it and then choose a stamp from my collection that I know the recipient will like. I get up, put my shoes on, take my letter and go on a walk around the local park until I spot the very unusual letterbox where a tree has grown to engulf it and I send my letter by posting it through the red letterbox. If this isn't slow living to enjoy the present I don't know what is.
data.boring_theme: putting a stamp on the envelop containing a letter to send it

data.output: My daughter was in a bad mood. She is a Leo star sign down to the letter! She will stamp her foot and huff and puff in the mornings when she does not want to wake up. I decided today was not the day to try and reason with her and the best thing to do was to send her back to bed until she felt better.
data.boring_theme: putting a stamp on the envelop containing a letter to send it

data.output: Once upon a time there was a retired postman called Edward. Over the years he had become obsessive with collecting stamps. One day he was at a retired postperson convention and he met other stamp collecting enthusiasts. He made a good friend in retired postwoman Sarah, and she showed him a brilliant stamp which seemed to have a moving face (of an ostrich) thanks to the silver holographic effect. They decided to stay in touch by letter to discuss their stamp collections and trade their weird and wonderful stamps. At Christmas Sarah decided to send Edward a letter with a special gift; she had sourced one of the rare ostrich stamps for him. Edward was delighted and decided to frame it.
data.boring_theme: putting a stamp on the envelop containing a letter to send it

data.output: Josie was a quiet girl who lived in a small village and had a hobby as a stamp collector. Her dad worked in the local post office so she had access to lots of stamps and loved seeing all the different types on the letters that came though the post office, although she would never use any of her stamp collection on normal letters herself, they were too special to her. When letters would be returned to the post office when a letter couldn't be posted, her father would send the old stamps her way.

data.output: The stamp was clean, unused and valid, but too small a denomination for the letter I had written. This rendered the stamp utterly useless but I did not want to waste it. So, I opened up my finished letter, and used it as a basis to write a much shorter note, which rendered the missive lighter, and the stamp was now useful. Of course, it was now destined elsewhere, and my original letter was unsent. But I chose to send the shorter letter and decided to hold on to the longer one until my correspondent's next birthday!

That was the last time he followed his therapist's idea of expressing his feelings in writing to a girl he liked.

data.output: Jonny was a quiet child. Mostly he liked to play with lego in front of the fire. He did not like doing the homework tasks sent home by his school. He found them confusing and difficult and dull. Jonny's parents decided that he should try to do his homework as soon as he got home from school and there would be no lego until he'd finished. Jonny hated this idea. "I'm tired when I get home. Why can't I play lego and then do my homework?"  "Because you need to learn your times tables. It's important"  Johnny found it really difficult to adjust to this new routine, dragging his feet on the way home and sometimes getting so annoyed he would stamp his feet and cry. Then he became reluctant to go to school at all and his parents started to become afraid to send him in, knowing there would be a battle over homework. One day after school, Jonny's parents found a letter from school in his schoolbag asking for a meeting.
